title: Use drawLine procedure to draw figure

content.description:
Consider the following procedure.

Procedure Call
Explanation

drawLine(x1, y1, x2, y2)
Draws a line segment on a coordinate grid with endpoints at coordinates (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)

The drawLine procedure is to be used to draw the following figure on a coordinate grid.
content.question: Which of the following code segments can be used to draw the figure?

choices.label:
xVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 1
yVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 0
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 1
REPEAT 5 TIMES
{
drawLine(xVal, yVal, xVal, yVal + len)
xVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> xVal + 1
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> len + 1
}

xVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 1
yVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 0
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 1
REPEAT 5 TIMES
{
drawLine(xVal, yVal, xVal + len, yVal)
yVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> yVal + 1
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> len + 1
}

xVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 5
yVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 0
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 5
REPEAT 5 TIMES
{
drawLine(xVal, yVal, xVal, yVal + len)
xVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> xVal - 1
}

xVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 5
yVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 0
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 5
REPEAT 5 TIMES
{
drawLine(xVal, yVal, xVal + len, yVal)
yVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> yVal - 1
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> len - 1
}

content.answer:
xVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 1
yVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 0
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 1
REPEAT 5 TIMES
{
drawLine(xVal, yVal, xVal, yVal + len)
xVal <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> xVal + 1
len <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> len + 1
}

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Use abstraction to manage complexity in a program.
